statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Austin Loop's long jump shot at the buzzer gave Marshall a wild 108-106 victory over Southern Mississippi in a Conference USA regular-season finale Saturday night.
article.headline: Loop's shot gives Marshall 108-106 OT win over Southern Miss
article.linkText: Loop's shot gives Marshall 108-106 OT win over Southern Miss
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. -- Austin Loop's long jump shot at the buzzer gave Marshall a wild 108-106 victory over Southern Mississippi in a Conference USA regular-season finale Saturday night. Jon Elmore scored a career-high 36 points for the Thundering Herd (16-15, 12-6), who recovered from a 23-point first-half deficit and sent the game into overtime on James Kelly's basket off an inbounds pass from Elmore that came with 0.4 on the clock. The Golden Eagles (5-13, 8-21), whose season came to end because of a self-imposed postseason ban, got a career-high 40 points from Kourtlin Jackson, who made six 3-pointers and 14 of 16 free throws before fouling out with 1:26 left in regulation and Southern Miss leading 93-87. Elmore gave Marshall its first lead since the opening minutes on his layup with 27 seconds left before the Golden Eagles made three free throws prior to Kelly's game-tying bucket at the buzzer. Keljin Blevins was called for a charge with eight seconds left in overtime, setting up Loop's game-winner. Elmore hit all 15 of his free throws in a game that featured 74 free throws and 57 fouls with five players disqualified. Kelly added 24 points and 12 rebounds, becoming the second player in Marshall history have 600 points and 300 rebounds in a single season. Russell Lee did it twice (1970-71, 1971-72). The Eagles hit half of their 30 3-point attempts and outrebounded Marshall 47-29 but had 22 turnovers to the Herd's six, which led to 37 points. Southern Miss coach Doc Sadler was tossed after his second technical with five minutes left in the second half. The victory gave Marshall a double bye into the quarterfinals of the conference tournament.
